channel.title: Stockwatch - Key Events
channel.description: Real-time corporate announcements, deals, and financial results.

item.title: [IOC] Indian Oil Corporation Ltd Announces Changes in Senior Management Personnel
item.description:
Indian Oil Corporation Ltd has announced changes in its senior management personnel. Pursuant to the Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations 2015, the following officials have been promoted to Senior Management Personnel (Executive Directors- One level below the Board of Directors): Sanjib Biswas, G R K Murthy, R R Raje, Samarendra Nath Jha, Nitin Bhatnagar, Sanjay Bhandari, Puneet Agarwal, Madhavi B. Patra, Girish Ranjan, and Sumit Basu. Their profiles and XBRL files will be provided in due course. This announcement is for information and record purposes.

  • Indian Oil Corporation Ltd announces changes in senior management personnel
  • Promotion of officials to Senior Management Personnel (Executive Directors- One level below the Board of Directors)
  • Promoted officials include Sanjib Biswas, G R K Murthy, R R Raje, Samarendra Nath Jha, Nitin Bhatnagar, Sanjay Bhandari, Puneet Agarwal, Madhavi B. Patra, Girish Ranjan, and Sumit Basu
  • Profiles and XBRL files of the promoted officials will be provided in due course
  • Announcement made pursuant to the Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations 2015

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: INDIAN OIL CORPORATION LTD. | Category: Business Update

item.title: [PFC] Power Finance Corporation Ltd. Announces Public Issue of Secured, Rated, Listed, Redeemable, Non-Convertible Debentures up to INR 5,000 Crores
item.description:
Power Finance Corporation Ltd. has announced a public issue of secured, rated, listed, redeemable, non-convertible debentures (NCDs) for an amount up to INR 5,000 crores. The Base Issue Size is INR 500 crores with an option to retain oversubscription up to INR 4,500 crores. The NCDs will be listed on the National Stock Exchange of India Limited. The tenor, interest rates, and other specific terms vary for different series of NCDs. The issue will open on January 16, 2026 and close on January 30, 2026.

  • Power Finance Corporation Ltd. announces a public issue of NCDs up to INR 5,000 crores.
  • The Base Issue Size is INR 500 crores with an option to retain oversubscription up to INR 4,500 crores.
  • The NCDs will be listed on the National Stock Exchange of India Limited.
  • Different series of NCDs have varying tenor, interest rates, and other specific terms.
  • The issue will open on January 16, 2026 and close on January 30, 2026.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: POWER FINANCE CORPORATION LTD. | Category: Investment

item.title: [GCSL] Gretex Corporate Services Ltd to Invest in Category Il Alternative Investment Fund via Bahutex Ventures LLP
item.description:
Gretex Corporate Services Ltd, in accordance with Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, proposes to invest in a Category Il Alternative Investment Fund through Bahutex Ventures LLP. The Company and Gretex Share Broking Limited will each hold a 50% partnership interest in Bahutex Ventures LLP. The proposed investment will be made against a total fund corpus up to X100 Crores (including the green shoe option). The continuing interest in the Fund shall be maintained by Bahutex Ventures LLP on an aggregate basis in accordance with the SEBI (Alternative Investment Funds) Regulations, 2012. The investment is in the ordinary course of business.

  • Gretex Corporate Services Ltd to invest in Category Il Alternative Investment Fund
  • Investment to be made through Bahutex Ventures LLP
  • Company and Gretex Share Broking Limited to hold 50% partnership interest each in Bahutex Ventures LLP
  • Proposed investment against a total fund corpus up to X100 Crores
  • Continuing interest in the Fund to be maintained by Bahutex Ventures LLP

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: Gretex Corporate Services Ltd | Category: Investment

item.title: [GCSL] Gretex Corporate Services Ltd to Invest in Category II Alternative Investment Fund via Bahutex Ventures LLP
item.description:
Gretex Corporate Services Ltd has disclosed its intention to invest in a Category II Alternative Investment Fund (AIF) through Bahutex Ventures LLP, which will act as the Sponsor/Manager. Gretex Corporate Services Ltd will become a Designated Partner and hold 50% partnership interest. The proposed investment will be made against a total fund corpus of up to 100 Crores, including the green shoe option. The investment is in the ordinary course of business.

  • Gretex Corporate Services Ltd to invest in a Category II Alternative Investment Fund
  • Investment to be made through Bahutex Ventures LLP
  • Gretex Corporate Services Ltd to become a Designated Partner with 50% partnership interest
  • Proposed investment against a total fund corpus of up to 100 Crores
  • Investment is in the ordinary course of business

Company: Gretex Corporate Services Ltd | Category: Investment

item.title: [GCSL] Gretex Corporate Services Ltd. Approves Q3 Results & Proposes Investment in Category II AIF
item.description:
Gretex Corporate Services Ltd. has announced its unaudited financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The company's revenue from operations and other income have been detailed in the statement. Additionally, the board has approved a proposed investment in a Category II Alternative Investment Fund (AIF) through Bahutex Ventures LLP, where Gretex Corporate Services Ltd. will hold a 50% partnership interest. The investment will be made against a total fund corpus up to 100 Crores.

  • Gretex Corporate Services Ltd. announced unaudited financial results for Q3 and nine months ended December 31, 2025.
  • The company's revenue from operations and other income have been detailed in the statement.
  • The board approved a proposed investment in a Category II AIF through Bahutex Ventures LLP.
  • Gretex Corporate Services Ltd. will hold a 50% partnership interest in the AIF.
  • The proposed investment will be made against a total fund corpus up to 100 Crores.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: Gretex Corporate Services Ltd | Category: Investment

item.title: [UCOBANK] UCO Bank Revises Benchmark Rates Effective from 11.01.2026
item.description:
UCO Bank has announced a revision in its benchmark rates, including MCLR, TBLR, and 10-year G-Sec Rate, effective from 11.01.2026. The Overnight, One month, Three month, Six month, and One year MCLR rates have been reduced by 5 basis points each. The TBLR rates for 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months have been reduced by 10 basis points, 5 basis points, and 5 basis points respectively. The 10-year G-Sec rate remains unchanged. Other benchmark rates such as 1 year G-Sec rate, Repo Linked Rates, Base Rate, and BPLR remain the same.

  • UCO Bank revises MCLR, TBLR, and 10-year G-Sec Rate.
  • Overnight, One month, Three month, Six month, and One year MCLR rates reduced by 5 basis points each.
  • TBLR rates for 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months reduced by 10 basis points, 5 basis points, and 5 basis points respectively.
  • 10-year G-Sec rate remains unchanged.
  • Other benchmark rates such as 1 year G-Sec rate, Repo Linked Rates, Base Rate, and BPLR remain the same.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: UCO BANK | Category: Quarterly Result

item.title: [PBAINFRA] PBA Infrastructure Ltd: No Deviation Statement Required for Public, Right, Preferential Issues since 2005
item.description:
PBA Infrastructure Ltd has released a statement declaring that they are not required to submit a Statement of Deviation or Variation for proceeds of Public issue, Right Issue, Preferential Issue, or Qualified Institutional Placement with the Stock Exchange. This is due to the fact that the company has not gone for any of these issue types since 2005, thus complying with Regulation 32(1), 32(2), and 32(3) of SEBI (LODR) Regulations 2015.

  • PBA Infrastructure Ltd has not gone for any public issue, right issue, preferential issue, or qualified institutional placement since 2005.
  • The company is not required to submit a Statement of Deviation or Variation for proceeds of such issues for the quarter ended 31st December, 2025.
  • This decision is in compliance with Regulation 32(1), 32(2), and 32(3) of SEBI (LODR) Regulations 2015.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: PBA INFRASTRUCTURE LTD. | Category: Business Update

item.title: [GCSL] Gretex Corporate Services Ltd. Approves Q3 Results and Investment in Category II AIF
item.description:
Gretex Corporate Services Ltd. announced the approval of its unaudited financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The company's revenue from operations and other income have been detailed in the statement. Additionally, the board approved an investment in a Category II Alternative Investment Fund (AIF) through Bahutex Ventures LLP, where Gretex Corporate Services Ltd. will hold a 50% partnership interest. This investment is in the ordinary course of business and will be made against a total fund corpus up to 100 Crores.

item.title: [THELEELA] Leela Palaces Hotels & Resorts Ltd Subsidiary Receives Favourable Transfer Pricing Order for AY 2023-24
item.description:
Leela Palaces Hotels & Resorts Ltd announced that its material subsidiary, Schloss Chanakya Private Limited (SCPL), received a favourable order from the Office of the Assistant Commissioner of Income Tax, Transfer Pricing, Delhi for the Assessment Year (AY) 2023-24. The order, issued under Section 92CA(3) of the Income-tax Act, 1961, determined the Armâ€™s Length Price for certain international transactions entered into by SCPL during FY 2022-23. The Transfer Pricing Officer concluded that no adverse inference is required in respect of the international transactions undertaken by the SCPL, resulting in no transfer pricing adjustment.

  • Leela Palaces Hotels & Resorts Ltd subsidiary, Schloss Chanakya Private Limited (SCPL), received a favourable transfer pricing order for AY 2023-24
  • The order determined the Armâ€™s Length Price for international transactions entered into by SCPL during FY 2022-23
  • The Transfer Pricing Officer found no adverse inference in respect of SCPL's international transactions
  • No transfer pricing adjustment was proposed as a result of the order
  • The order is in favour of SCPL and has no adverse financial impact on the Company

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: Leela Palaces Hotels & Resorts Ltd | Category: Quarterly Result

item.title: [DRREDDY] Dr Reddys Laboratories Receives USFDA's Post-Application Action Letter for Biologics Manufacturing Facility
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Dr Reddys Laboratories Ltd. has received a Post-Application Action Letter (PAAL) from the United States Food & Drug Administration (USFDA) in relation to the response submitted for the Pre-Approval Inspection (PAI) at their biologics manufacturing facility in Bachupally, Hyderabad. The company is committed to addressing the queries specified in the PAAL and will work closely with the USFDA.

  • Dr Reddys Laboratories has received a Post-Application Action Letter (PAAL) from the USFDA
  • The PAAL is in relation to the Pre-Approval Inspection (PAI) at their biologics manufacturing facility in Bachupally, Hyderabad
  • The company is committed to addressing the queries specified in the PAAL
  • Dr Reddys Laboratories will work closely with the USFDA
  • This disclosure is made under Regulation 30 of SEBI (LODR) Regulations, 2015

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: DR.REDDY'S LABORATORIES LTD. | Category: USFDA
